revised_title: Conservation Genetics and Phylogeography of European Brown Bears
tldr: The authors studied the mitochondrial DNA polymorphism and phylogeography of the brown bear (Ursus arctos) in Europe to identify potential conservation units. They found two distinct lineages and two clades within the western lineage, which correspond to different ancestral refugia. This study demonstrates the relevance of molecular phylogeography for identifying conservation units and managing endangered populations.
